maml:description.maml:para: Sets the API key for the DBPool.
The Add-DBPoolApiKey cmdlet sets the API key which is used to authenticate API calls made to DBPool.
Once the API key is defined, the secret key is encrypted using SecureString.
The DBPool API key is retrieved via the DBPool UI at My Profile -> API key
Defines your API key for the DBPool.
Defines your API key for the DBPool.

dev:type.maml:name: [SecureString] - The API key for the DBPool.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Prompts to enter in your personal API key.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Add-DBPoolApiKey -ApiKey $secureString Read-Host "Enter your DBPool API Key" -AsSecureString | Add-DBPoolApiKey

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the API key for the DBPool.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the base URI for the DBPool API connection.
The Add-DBPoolBaseURI cmdlet sets the base URI which is later used to construct the full URI for all API calls.
Define the base URI for the DBPool API connection using Datto's DBPool URI or a custom URI.
DBPool's URI connection point that can be one of the predefined data centers.
The accepted values for this parameter are: [ DEFAULT ] DEFAULT = https://dbpool.datto.net
Placeholder for other data centers.
Define the base URI for the DBPool API connection using Datto's DBPool URI or a custom URI.
DBPool's URI connection point that can be one of the predefined data centers.
The accepted values for this parameter are: [ DEFAULT ] DEFAULT = https://dbpool.datto.net
Placeholder for other data centers.

dev:type.maml:name: [string] - The base URI for the DBPool API connection.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The base URI will use https://dbpool.datto.net which is Datto's default DBPool URI.
The base URI will use https://dbpool.datto.net which is DBPool's default URI.
A custom API gateway of http://dbpool.example.com will be used for all API calls to DBPool's API.

maml:description.maml:para: Converts uri filter parameters
As of June 2024, DBPool does not support any query parameters. This is only provided to allow forward compatibility
The ConvertTo-DBPoolQueryString cmdlet converts & formats uri filter parameters from a function which are later used to make the full resource uri for an API call
This is an internal helper function the ties in directly with the Invoke-DBPoolRequest & any public functions that define parameters
As of June 2024, DBPool does not support any query parameters. This is only provided to allow forward compatibility
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the resource_Uri parameter.
This allows for the full uri query to occur
As of June 2024, DBPool does not support any query parameters. This is only provided to allow forward compatibility
Defines the short resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the resource_Uri parameter.
This allows for the full uri query to occur
As of June 2024, DBPool does not support any query parameters. This is only provided to allow forward compatibility
Defines the short resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call

dev:remarks.maml:para: Example: (From public function) $uri_Filter = @{}
ForEach ( $Key in $PSBoundParameters.GetEnumerator() ){ if( $excludedParameters -contains $Key.Key ){$null} else{ $uri_Filter += @{ $Key.Key = $Key.Value } } }
1x key = https://api.DBPool.com/v1/api/v2/containers?parentId=12345 2x key = https://api.DBPool.com/v1/api/v2/containers?parentId=12345&power=True

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the DBPool BaseURI, API Key, & JSON configuration information to file.
The Export-DBPoolModuleSetting cmdlet exports the DBPool BaseURI, API Key, & JSON configuration information to file.

Making use of PowerShell's System.Security.SecureString type, exporting module settings encrypts your API key in a format that can only be unencrypted with the your Windows account as this encryption is tied to your user principal. This means that you cannot copy your configuration file to another computer or user account and expect it to work.
Define the location to store the DBPool configuration file.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI
Define the name of the DBPool configuration file.
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Define the location to store the DBPool configuration file.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI
Define the name of the DBPool configuration file.
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Validates that the BaseURI, API Key, and JSON depth are set then exports their values to the current user's DBPool configuration file located at: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI\config.psd1
Validates that the BaseURI, API Key, and JSON depth are set then exports their values to the current user's DBPool configuration file located at: C:\DBPoolAPI\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the DBPool API key global variable.
The Get-DBPoolApiKey cmdlet gets the DBPool API key global variable and returns this as an object.
Decrypt and return the API key in plain text.
Decrypt and return the API key in plain text.

dev:type.maml:name: [PSCustomObject] - The DBPool API key global variable.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the DBPool API key global variable and returns this as an object with the secret key as a SecureString.
Gets the DBPool API key global variable and returns this as an object with the secret key as plain text.

maml:description.maml:para: Shows the DBPool base URI global variable.
The Get-DBPoolBaseURI cmdlet shows the DBPool base URI global variable value.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Shows the DBPool base URI global variable value.

maml:description.maml:para: The Get-DBPoolContainer function retrieves container information from the DBPool API.
This function retrieves container details from the DBPool API.
It can get containers, parent containers, or child containers, and also retrieve containers or container status by ID. This also can filter or exclude by container name or database.
The ID of the container details to get from the DBPool. This parameter is required when using the 'ContainerStatus' parameter set.
Retrieves a list of containers from the DBPool API. This is the default parameter set.
Filters containers returned from the DBPool API by name. Accepts wildcard input.
Filters containers returned from the DBPool API by database. Accepts wildcard input.
Excludes containers returned from the DBPool API by Name or DefaultDatabase using the -NotLike switch. Requires the -Name or -DefaultDatabase parameter to be specified.
Returns containers where the Name or DefaultDatabase does not match the provided filter.
The ID of the container details to get from the DBPool. This parameter is required when using the 'ContainerStatus' parameter set.
Retrieves a list of parent containers from the DBPool API.
Filters containers returned from the DBPool API by name. Accepts wildcard input.
Filters containers returned from the DBPool API by database. Accepts wildcard input.
Excludes containers returned from the DBPool API by Name or DefaultDatabase using the -NotLike switch. Requires the -Name or -DefaultDatabase parameter to be specified.
Returns containers where the Name or DefaultDatabase does not match the provided filter.
Retrieves a list of child containers from the DBPool API.
The ID of the container details to get from the DBPool. This parameter is required when using the 'ContainerStatus' parameter set.
Gets the status of a container by ID. Returns basic container details, and dockerContainerRunning, mysqlServiceResponding, and mysqlServiceRespondingCached statuses.
Retrieves a list of containers from the DBPool API. This is the default parameter set.
Retrieves a list of parent containers from the DBPool API.
Retrieves a list of child containers from the DBPool API.
The ID of the container details to get from the DBPool. This parameter is required when using the 'ContainerStatus' parameter set.
Gets the status of a container by ID. Returns basic container details, and dockerContainerRunning, mysqlServiceResponding, and mysqlServiceRespondingCached statuses.
Filters containers returned from the DBPool API by name. Accepts wildcard input.
Filters containers returned from the DBPool API by database. Accepts wildcard input.
Excludes containers returned from the DBPool API by Name or DefaultDatabase using the -NotLike switch. Requires the -Name or -DefaultDatabase parameter to be specified.
Returns containers where the Name or DefaultDatabase does not match the provided filter.

dev:type.maml:name: [int] - The ID of the container to get details for.
[string] - The name of the container to get details for.
[string] - The database of the container to get details for.
[PSCustomObject] - The response from the DBPool API.

maml:alert.maml:para: The -Name, and -DefaultDatabase parameters are not native endpoints of the DBPool API. This is a custom function which uses 'Where-Object', along with the optional -NotLike parameter to return the response using the provided filter.
If no match is found an error is output, and the original response is returned.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a list of all containers from the DBPool API
Get a list of containers from the DBPool API by ID
Get the status of an array of containers by IDs
Get a list of parent containers from the DBPool API
Get a list of parent containers from the DBPool API by ID
Get a list of child containers from the DBPool API
Uses 'Where-Object' to get a list of containers from the DBPool API, or parent containers by name Accepts wildcard input
Uses 'Where-Object' to get a list of containers from the DBPool API, or parent containers where the name does not match the filter Accepts wildcard input
Get a list of containers from the DBPool API, or parent containers by database Accepts wildcard input
Get a list of containers from the DBPool API, or parent containers where the database does not match the filter Accepts wildcard input

maml:description.maml:para: Gets various API metadata values
The Get-DBPoolMetaData cmdlet gets various API metadata values from an Invoke-WebRequest to assist in various troubleshooting scenarios such as rate-limiting.
Define the base URI for the DBPool API connection using Datto's DBPool URI or a custom URI.
The default base URI is https://dbpool.datto.net
Define the resource URI for the DBPool API connection.
The default resource URI is /api/v2/self
Define the base URI for the DBPool API connection using Datto's DBPool URI or a custom URI.
The default base URI is https://dbpool.datto.net
Define the resource URI for the DBPool API connection.
The default resource URI is /api/v2/self

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets various API metadata values from an Invoke-WebRequest to assist in various troubleshooting scenarios such as rate-limiting.
The default full base uri test path is: https://dbpool.datto.net
Gets various API metadata values from an Invoke-WebRequest to assist in various troubleshooting scenarios such as rate-limiting.
The full base uri test path in this example is: http://dbpool.example.com/device

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the saved DBPool configuration settings
The Get-DBPoolModuleSetting cmdlet gets the saved DBPool configuration settings from the local system.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI
Define the location to store the DBPool configuration file.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI
Define the name of the DBPool configuration file.
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Opens the DBPool configuration file
Define the location to store the DBPool configuration file.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI
Define the name of the DBPool configuration file.
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Opens the DBPool configuration file

The default location of the DBPool configuration file is: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI\config.psd1
Opens the configuration file from the defined location in the default editor
The location of the DBPool configuration file in this example is: C:\DBPoolAPI\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the DBPool OpenAPI documentation.
Gets the OpenAPI json spec for the DBPool API documentation.
The path to the OpenAPI json spec. This defaults to '/api/docs/openapi.json'
The path to the OpenAPI json spec. This defaults to '/api/docs/openapi.json'

dev:type.maml:name: [PSCustomObject] - The OpenAPI json spec for the DBPool API documentation.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will get the OpenAPI json spec for the DBPool API documentation.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a user from DBPool
The Get-DBPoolUser function is used to get a user details from DBPool. Default will get the current authenticated user details, but can be used to get any user details by username.
The username of the user to get details for. This accepts an array of strings.
The username of the user to get details for. This accepts an array of strings.

dev:type.maml:name: [string] - The username of the user to get details for.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will get the user details for the current authenticated user.
This will get the user details for the user "John.Doe".

maml:description.maml:para: Imports the DBPool BaseURI, API Key, & JSON configuration information to the current session.
The Import-DBPoolModuleSetting cmdlet imports the DBPool BaseURI, API Key, & JSON configuration information stored in the DBPool configuration file to the users current session.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI
Define the location to store the DBPool configuration file.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI

By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Define the location to store the DBPool configuration file.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI

By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1

The default location of the DBPool configuration file is: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI\config.psd1
Validates that the configuration file created with the Export-DBPoolModuleSetting cmdlet exists then imports the stored data into the current users session.

maml:description.maml:para: The Invoke-DBPoolContainerAccess function is used to interact with various container access operations in the Datto DBPool API.
The Invoke-DBPoolContainerAccess function is used to Get, Add, or Remove access to a container in the Datto DBPool API based on a given username.
The ID of the container to access. This accepts an array of integers.
The username to access the container. This accepts an array of strings.
Gets the current access to a container by ID for the given username.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The ID of the container to access. This accepts an array of integers.
The username to access the container. This accepts an array of strings.
Adds access to a container by ID for the given username.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The ID of the container to access. This accepts an array of integers.
The username to access the container. This accepts an array of strings.
Removes access to a container by ID for the given username.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The ID of the container to access. This accepts an array of integers.
The username to access the container. This accepts an array of strings.
Gets the current access to a container by ID for the given username.
Adds access to a container by ID for the given username.
Removes access to a container by ID for the given username.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: [int] - The ID of the container to access.
[string] - The username to access the container.
[PSCustomObject] - The response from the DBPool API.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will get access to the container with ID 12345 for the user "John.Doe"
This will add access to the containers with ID 12345, and 56789 for the user "John.Doe"
This will remove access to the container with ID 12345 for the users "Jane.Doe", and "John.Doe"

maml:description.maml:para: The Invoke-DBPoolContainerAction function is used to interact with various container action operations in the Datto DBPool API.
The Invoke-DBPoolContainerAction function is used to perform actions on a container such as refresh, schema-merge, start, restart, or stop.
The action to perform on the container. Valid actions are: refresh, schema-merge, start, restart, or stop.
Start, Stop, and Restart are all considered minor actions and will not require a confirmation prompt. Refresh and Schema-Merge are considered major actions and will require a confirmation prompt.
The ID(s) of the container(s) to perform the action on.
Skip the confirmation prompt for major actions, such as 'Refresh' and 'Schema-Merge'.
The maximum time in seconds to wait for the action to complete. Default is 3600 seconds (60 minutes).
The maximum number of containers to process in parallel. Default is twice the number of processor cores.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The action to perform on the container. Valid actions are: refresh, schema-merge, start, restart, or stop.
Start, Stop, and Restart are all considered minor actions and will not require a confirmation prompt. Refresh and Schema-Merge are considered major actions and will require a confirmation prompt.
The ID(s) of the container(s) to perform the action on.
Skip the confirmation prompt for major actions, such as 'Refresh' and 'Schema-Merge'.
The maximum time in seconds to wait for the action to complete. Default is 3600 seconds (60 minutes).
The maximum number of containers to process in parallel. Default is twice the number of processor cores.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: [int] - The ID of the container to perform the action on.
[string] - The action to perform on the container.

maml:alert.maml:para: refresh: Recreate the Docker container and ZFS snapshot for the container.

schema-merge: Attempt to apply upstream changes to the parent container to this child container. This may break your container. Refreshing a container is the supported way to update a child container's database schema.
start: Start the Docker container for the container.
restart: Stop and start the Docker container.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will restart the container with ID 12345
This will refresh the containers with ID 12345, and 56789

maml:description.maml:para: Provides an example exception response from the DBPool API for debugging purposes.
Uses the Invoke-DBPoolRequest function to make a request to the DBPool API. Returns an example exception response for debugging and testing purposes.
The HTTP method to use when making the request to the DBPool API. Default is 'GET'.
The HTTP method to use when making the request to the DBPool API. Default is 'GET'.

dev:type.maml:name: [System.Management.Automation.ErrorRecord] - Returns an example exception response from the DBPool API.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sends a 'GET' request to the DBPool API and returns a '418' exception response error.

maml:description.maml:para: Internal function to make an API request to the DBPool API
The Invoke-DBPoolRequest cmdlet invokes an API request to DBPool API
This is an internal function that is used by all public functions
Defines the type of API method to use
Allowed values: 'DEFAULT', 'DELETE', 'GET', 'HEAD', 'PATCH', 'POST', 'PUT'
Defines the resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Used with the internal function [ ConvertTo-DBPoolQueryString ] to combine a functions parameters with the resource_Uri parameter.
This allows for the full uri query to occur
The full resource path is made with the following data $DBPool_Base_URI + $resource_Uri + ConvertTo-DBPoolQueryString
As of June 2024, DBPool does not support any query parameters. This is only provided to allow forward compatibility
Defines the data to be sent with the API request body when using POST or PATCH
Defines the depth of the JSON conversion for the 'data' parameter request body
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters
As of June 2024, DBPool does not support any paging parameters. This is only provided to allow forward compatibility
Defines the type of API method to use
Allowed values: 'DEFAULT', 'DELETE', 'GET', 'HEAD', 'PATCH', 'POST', 'PUT'
Defines the resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Used with the internal function [ ConvertTo-DBPoolQueryString ] to combine a functions parameters with the resource_Uri parameter.
This allows for the full uri query to occur
The full resource path is made with the following data $DBPool_Base_URI + $resource_Uri + ConvertTo-DBPoolQueryString
As of June 2024, DBPool does not support any query parameters. This is only provided to allow forward compatibility
Defines the data to be sent with the API request body when using POST or PATCH
Defines the depth of the JSON conversion for the 'data' parameter request body
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters
As of June 2024, DBPool does not support any paging parameters. This is only provided to allow forward compatibility

dev:type.maml:name: [Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.BasicHtmlWebResponseObject] - The response from the DBPool API

dev:remarks.maml:para: Name Value ---- ----- Method GET Uri https://dbpool.datto.net/api/v2/self Headers {X-App-Apikey = 3feb2b29-919c-409c-985d-e99cbae43a6d} Body
Invoke an API request against the defined resource using any of the provided parameters

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-DBPoolRequest -method GET -resource_Uri '/api/openapi.json' -uri_Filter $uri_Filter Name Value ---- ----- Method GET Uri https://dbpool.datto.net/api/openapi.json Headers {X-App-Apikey = 3feb2b29-919c-409c-985d-e99cbae43a6d} Body

dev:remarks.maml:para: Invoke an API request against the defined resource using any of the provided parameters

maml:description.maml:para: The New-DBPoolContainer function is used to create a new container from the DBPool API.

This function creates a new container in the DBPool based on the provided container name and parent container information. The ContainerName parameter is mandatory, and at least one of the parent parameters (ParentId, ParentName, or ParentDefaultDatabase) must be specified.
The name for the new container.
The ID of the parent container to clone.
The name of the parent container to clone.
The default database of the parent container to clone.
Force the operation without confirmation.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The name for the new container.
The ID of the parent container to clone.
The name of the parent container to clone.
The default database of the parent container to clone.
Force the operation without confirmation.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: [string] - The name for the new container.
[int] - The ID of the parent container to clone.
[string] - The name of the parent container to clone.
[string] - The default database of the parent container to clone.
[PSCustomObject] - The response from the DBPool API.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will create a new container named 'MyNewContainer' based on the parent container with ID 12345.
This will create a new container named 'MyNewContainer' based on the piped in parent container.

maml:description.maml:para: The Remove-DBPoolContainer function is used to delete a container in the DBPool.
The Remove-DBPoolContainer function is used to delete containers in the DBPool based on the provided container ID.
!! This is a destructive operation and will destory the container !!
The ID of the container to delete. This accepts an array of integers.
Forces the removal of the container without prompting for confirmation.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the stored DBPool configuration folder.
The Remove-DBPoolModuleSetting cmdlet removes the DBPool folder and its files. This cmdlet also has the option to remove sensitive DBPool variables as well.
By default configuration files are stored in the following location and will be removed: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI
Define the location of the DBPool configuration folder.
By default the configuration folder is located at: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI
Define if sensitive DBPool variables should be removed as well.
By default the variables are not removed.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Define the location of the DBPool configuration folder.
By default the configuration folder is located at: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI
Define if sensitive DBPool variables should be removed as well.
By default the variables are not removed.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Checks to see if the default configuration folder exists and removes it if it does.
The default location of the DBPool configuration folder is: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI
Checks to see if the defined configuration folder exists and removes it if it does. If sensitive DBPool variables exist then they are removed as well.
The location of the DBPool configuration folder in this example is: C:\DBPoolAPI

maml:description.maml:para: The Rename-DBPoolContainer function is used to update a container in the DBPool.
The Rename-DBPoolContainer function is used to change the name a container in the DBPool API.
The ID of the container to update. This accepts an array of integers.
The new name for the container.
The ID of the container to update. This accepts an array of integers.
The new name for the container.

dev:type.maml:name: [int] - The ID of the container to update.
[string] - The new name for the container.
[PSCustomObject] - The response from the DBPool API.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will update the container with ID 12345 to have the name 'NewContainerName'
This will update the containers with ID 12345, and 56789 to have the name 'NewContainerName'

maml:description.maml:para: The Set-DBPoolApiParameter function is used to set parameters for the Datto DBPool API.
The Set-DBPoolApiParameter function is used to set the API URL and API Key for the Datto DBPool API.
Provide the URL of the Datto DBPool API. The default value is https://dbpool.datto.net.
Provide Datto DBPool API Key for authorization. You can find your user API key at \ /web/self \ (https://dbpool.datto.net/web/self).
Force the operation without confirmation.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Provide the URL of the Datto DBPool API. The default value is https://dbpool.datto.net.

Force the operation without confirmation.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

[SecureString] - The API key for the DBPool.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the default base URI and prompts for the API Key.
Sets the base URI to https://dbpool.example.com and sets the API Key.

maml:description.maml:para: Checks the availability of the DBPool API using an HTTP HEAD request.
This function sends an HTTP HEAD request to the specified API URL using Invoke-WebRequest. Checks if the HTTP status code is 200, indicating that the API is available.
The base URL of the API to be checked.
The URI of the API resource to be checked.
The default value is '/api/docs/openapi.json'.
Optional: Access token for authorization.
The base URL of the API to be checked.
The URI of the API resource to be checked.
The default value is '/api/docs/openapi.json'.
Optional: Access token for authorization.

dev:type.maml:name: [string] - The base URI for the DBPool API connection.
[SecureString] - The API key for the DBPool.
[System.Boolean] - Returns $true if the API is available, $false if not.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Checks the availability of the API at https://api.example.com

maml:description.maml:para: Test the DBPool API Key.
The Test-DBPoolApiKey cmdlet tests the base URI & API Key that were defined in the Add-DBPoolBaseURI & Add-DBPoolAPIKey cmdlets.
Define the base URI for the DBPool API connection using Datto's DBPool URI or a custom URI.
The default base URI is https://dbpool.datto.net/api
Define the base URI for the DBPool API connection using Datto's DBPool URI or a custom URI.
The default base URI is https://dbpool.datto.net/api

dev:remarks.maml:para: Tests the base URI & API key that was defined in the Add-DBPoolBaseURI & Add-DBPoolAPIKey cmdlets.
The default full base uri test path is: https://dbpool.datto.net/api/v2/self
Tests the base URI & API key that was defined in the Add-DBPoolBaseURI & Add-DBPoolAPIKey cmdlets.
The full base uri test path in this example is: http://dbpool.example.com/api/v2/self
